page.topic: PhoneGap File System Actions - (File URI Based) Action Javascript
page.description: The PhoneGap File System Actions - (File URI Based) Action Javascript allows you to perform an action on a mobile device's file system in a PhoneGap application. The directory in which the file system action is performed is specified using a file URI.

discussion.p: PhoneGap File System Actions - (File URI Based) is similar to [PhoneGap - File System Actions] in that both actions allow you to perform actions on the device's file system, such as read a file, write a file, create a directory, delete a directory, etc. The key difference is PhoneGap File System Actions - (File URI Based) gives you explicit control over where the operations are performed in the device's file system by specifying a file URI. [PhoneGap - File System Actions] only operates on files in a default location.
You can perform the following actions using PhoneGap File System Actions - (File URI Based) Action Javascript:

item.name: File System Is Available
item.description: Returns true if PhoneGap is running an the local file system is available.

item.name: Get Base URI of Requested File System Part
item.description: Returns the file URI of the requested part of the file system. Your code can request the URI for the following abstract file system parts: 'temp', 'private', 'saved' or 'public'.

item.name: Read a File
item.description: Read the contents of a file. Optionally specify a starting and ending position in the file.

item.name: Write a File
item.description: Write a file. Optionally specify if the data should be appended to the end of the existing data if the file already exists.

item.name: Check if file exists
item.description: Check if a file exists. If the file does exist, the callback function is called with the properties of the file (such as size, date last updated, etc.).

item.name: Remove a directory (recursively)
item.description: Deletes the specified directory and all of its contents, including other directories and their contents.

item.name: Create directories (recursively)
item.description: Ensures that a directory structure (specified by subdirpath) exists within the specified rootpath. If the directories do not exist, they are created.

item.name: List files in a directory (recursively)
item.description: List files in a directory and the sub-directories of the specified directory.

item.name: List matching files in a directory
item.description: List files in a directory. If a filter (defined by a regular expression) is specified only matching files are listed.

item.name: Delete matching files
item.description: Delete files. If a filter (defined by a regular expression) is specified, only matching files are deleted. If a 'keep list' is specified files in the list are not deleted, even if they matched.
